original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽16.84. Sanidassanattika, Sappītikaduka🔽Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ sappītikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanaappaṭigho nasappītiko🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ sappītikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho🔽nasappītiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …pe… anidassanaappaṭighaṁ sappītikaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  sani dassana ttika sappi itika duka  anidassana appaṭigham sappītikam dhammam paṭicca na anidassana appaṭighaḥ na sappītikaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā anidassana appaṭigham sappītikam dhammam paṭicca na sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ  na sappītikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pe anidassana appaṭigham sappītikam dhamma
translated: The forward and reverse order of conditions in relation to mental phenomena, the triplets and couplets in the Paṭṭhāna,

original: paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho nasappītiko ca naanidassanasappaṭigho nasappītiko🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.🔽Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ appītikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho naappītiko
analyzed: paṭicca na sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ na sappītikaḥ ca na a nidassana sa paṭighaḥ na sappītikaḥ 🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha ārammaṇe tīṇi pe avigate cha 🔽anidassana appaṭigham appītikam dhammam paṭicca na sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ na appītikaḥ

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ appītikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanasappaṭigho
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā anidassana appaṭigham appītikam dhammam paṭicca na anidassana sappaṭighaḥ
translated: A non-evident, non-inconstant, non-perceivable mental factor arises conditioned by a non-evident, non-inconstant, non-perceivable mental factor.🔽A non-evident, non-inconstant, non-perceivable mental factor arises conditioned by a non-evident, non-inconstant, non-perceivable mental factor.

original: naappītiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ appītikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽nasanidassanasappaṭigho naappītiko ca naanidassanasappaṭigho naappītiko ca dhammā
analyzed: na appītikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā anidassana appaṭigham appītikam dhammam paṭicca  na sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ na appītikaḥ ca na anidassana sa paṭighaḥ na appītikaḥ ca dhammā
translated: A non-evident, non-inconstant, non-perceivable mental factor arises conditioned by a non-evident, non-inconstant, non-perceivable mental factor.

original: uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: uppajjanti hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: (In brief.) In the section on root cause there are three triplets and three duals. In the section on condition there are three triplets and three duals. In the section on non-obstruction there are three triplets and three duals.
